name: Bluestone

reviews.text: We booked this weekend as pre christmas break as we are very busy in the festive season. The Elf school sounded great in great surroundings and to be fair The kingdom of the elves was fantastic and Father Xmas was the best !!!! All in all the staff were great.
reviews.title: 5 Star ????

reviews.text: We arrived Friday 11th Nov, checking in was painless, we soon found our Lodge but I was so pleased i had booked a golf buggie as we were as far away from the Blue lagoon as we could be.... and to be fair I was going to book bikes....... Good job I did not... Chris baldman would have found the terrain a challenge !!!
reviews.title: Pleasant and relaxing - despite rain!

reviews.text: As we had arrived quiet late in the afternoon we were quiet keen to get up to the Blue lagoon ( Swimming pool ) The site offers take a way Food delivery so i thought I would book it up in advance prior to leaving for the pool. The member of staff told me it was not possible to order in advance ( the time was 6.30pm ish ) but when we got back we could order at say 8.45 and the food would arrive at 9.15...... Spot on !!!! The evening swim was great,( NOTE !!! READ ON LATER FOR MORE DETAILS OF NOT SO GOOD SWIM ) We got back and i rang to order the food.... time was 8.30 pm, " Sorry sir, your food wont be with you for at least 1 1/2 hours !!!! I was not happy, the girl was not very helpful but we were starving, the food arrived at 9.40 pm EARLY !!! But hardly edible, out of 10 ....... 1 !!! And they had forgot our Coke.. so i rang for this to be delivered.....it arrived at 10 o'clock !!! So I blew .....The lad was very apologetic and said he would sort it in the morning..... The next morning we were in the Activity Center ( Which to be fair was pretty good ) and the lad from the night before came upto me with a refund from the night before.... I was shocked to be fair.... but the food was rank..
reviews.title: Pricey and rather disappointing

reviews.text: Another worrying problem we encountered. On Sunday we returned to the Blue Lagoon for a final swim, the wave machine was great but Lazy river ( A channel of water that has air pressure pumped into it to make like a river torent ) was not working properly I asked the life Guard twice why it was not on....... his answer was " It is "........ sorry to say it was not.... oviousley Blue stones had not made enough money to run this on Sunday night !!!!!! This was not the problem though, I was sat watching my eldest playing when I saw a lady carrying a very young baby desperatly trying to get into Lazy river... her other child had slipped into the stream and was going under, the Life guard above quickly blew his whistle and threw in a foam life saver...... Great I thought he will jump in now .... did he bloody hell !!!! he just watched !!!! I wadded across as the lady was trying to pull her son out and hold the baby... i asked if she need help and carried the lad into the swallows..............THE LIFE GUARD STOOD THERE SMILING ! very funny ( Check the CTV if you dont believe me )
reviews.title: Pure Family Fun and Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To Finish Blue Lagoon Brill but to dangerous, Activity Center Good but only for short Period, Food NO THANKS ( Cost me a fortune traveling to find good eaterys ), Staff pretty good, Absolutely nothing to do with kids in the evenings !!!No way is it 5 star , 3 1/2 JUST !!! Will be going back to Pembrokeshire but not Blue Stones
reviews.title: Nice place to get away from it for a few days and will certainly go back

reviews.text: Stayed in November- plenty of indoor activities - better value than center parcs, with pembrokeshire on the doorstep. Lots of free activities and a great swimming pool. Heatheton park nearby is better value for paid activities. Nearby narberth is great for local food supplies .
reviews.title: Very good value , with plenty to do.

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bed (sleeps 4) Ramsey with an en suite in each bedroom. The upside down arrangement worked really well for us as we were able to see the stunning view from the lounge. We have relatives in Wales and just wanted somewhere for the weekend so a short break was ideal for us. Our late arrival at 2am Saturday morning with two tired children was smooth and faultless. To arrive with beds made and everything sparkly clean was a huge benefit to us.
reviews.title: Bluestone in beautiful Pembrokeshire, Wales

reviews.text: We visited mid November and it was very peaceful and relaxing. Our children are 9 and 15 and there was plenty for them to do. My daughter (9) tried out the adventure centre which was a perfect introduction to climbing walls and high ropes etc and was great value for money.
reviews.title: Bluestone PembrokeshireKingdom of the elves

reviews.text: The staff were so helpful and safety was obviously a high priority. My daughter came away already planning her next visit for the Deep Ravine when she reaches 10! We also used the pool with slides and rivers etc which we all love and always visit when in the area.
reviews.title: Bluestone short break

reviews.text: The Oakwood Theme Park is right next door and is a theme park we really love.
reviews.title: Excellent break but term time is disappointing
Bluestone Probably better for families than couples
reviews.text: Very much children orientated place. The site is pretty if not a bit lacking in character.

Good points: Good location Well equipped cosy lodges with good sound proffing. Cabins all standard - nobody got any better than anyone else. Internet free. TV worked well but hubby thought sound wasn't good. Car free site.
reviews.title: Fabulous break

reviews.text: Bad points: Hair dryers were not provided and had to be hired. I found the settees uncomfortable although they looked nice. Lack of lighting on the paths which was ok after you got used to it, but disorienting on arrival. Expensive although organised shop. Maybe could have done with a small launderette.
reviews.title: first visit and we will be back!!

reviews.text: We spent a long weekend at Bluestone resort at the end of October. It was our first trip to this sort of resort and we had a fantastic stay. We went for the inclusive option which provided two main meals daily, plus three activities, a visit for each adult to the spa and a single treatment over the course of the weekend.
reviews.title: Great long weekend but cleanliness of accommodation let it down

reviews.text: The whole experience was just wonderful. The staff, food, accomodation and activities were all perfect. The location was fantastic, please do not be put off by other reviews moaning about the steep hills, my two and half year old son was able to walk across the site with ease as was I pushing a pram with a seven month old in. At no point did we miss having a golf buggy, in fact we welcomed the chance to get some air into our lungs.
reviews.title: 4th visit and still does not disappoint

reviews.text: There were lots to do and the cabins were clean and tidy. I will come back eventually. The only downside to this stay was that the beds were uncomfortable. ther's a big swimming pool for kid AND adults,there's playing area for kids. There was a bar for the adults and a few restaurants with great food quality. You could hire a golf buggy if you got tired. bluestone is well worth a week of your time.
reviews.title: great fun for kids and adults

reviews.text: A great place to relax and let the kids enjoy themselves, and the big kids with the golf buggy hire. We stayed in a caldey impressive accommodation, clean, well equipped, warm and cosy. The beds at first felt uncomfortable but we all slept well and didn't complain in the morning... The yard and the adventure centre cafe were great and we all loved blue lagoon. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Loved it will be back

reviews.text: We stayed at Bluestone for the first time mid-november for a long weeked, 2 couples both with 1 year old babies. We have visited Centre Parcs so many times before, we wanted something different and the price of Bluestone was about £400 less for the same weekend. We weren't disappointed. The accomodation was amazing, we stayed in a Gateholm 4 bed lodge. It looked brand new, huge bedrooms and bathrooms just as large with wet areas for shower plus 2 baths, very clean, lovely big soft towels and beds already made. We were relieved to find stair gates at the top and bottom stairs (these could be put away easily when the kids were in bed). There was also a high chair (no extra cost). Compared to a 4 bed lodge at Centre parcs Gateholm was at least twice the size.
reviews.title: Fab weekend at Bluestone

reviews.text: We hired a golf buggy which i would recommend as the site is hilly and it was fun driving it around, they had Christmas lights up and it was a lovely quiet and pretty area, great views.
reviews.title: Just what we needed...

reviews.text: The swimming pool was fab, and waves were great. There was a baby pool where the little ones could crawl about in safety. There is an indoor adverture centre which we were really impressed with, normally 1 year olds aren't catered for, but there were little buggys and baby walkers for them to use, plus the obvious ball pit. There were so many things to do for all ages there, and hardly any had an extra charge to use them. You could easily stay there all day (cafe next to it!).
reviews.title: Really disappointing food

reviews.text: We booked a 4 night trip in the kid's half term. An ideal break. I had a spa session with back massage and facial £60 but it was lovely. My husband and one son did the high ropes activity which they really enjoyed. The pool is great. Staff were all friendly. The only downside was the cost of drinks in the pub. This didn't however put us off. Will definitely book again.
reviews.title: A lovely place that we all enjoy

reviews.text: We recently booked a long weekend stay at bluestone. We live in Bristol so it took us 3 hours to get there but I needs better sign posting there. On arrival, we were greeted in a friendly manner and told and shown where to go to get to our lodge.
reviews.title: Will be coming back!

reviews.text: We arrived in our 4 bedroom Ramsey lodge, which was exellent, apart from one dirty window. That evening we went for a meal in the pub, which was exellent food but needs more seating.
reviews.title: Excellent all over for families

reviews.text: The following morning, we went on our pre-booked treasure hunt, which was exellent, great fun for the whole family.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.text: The blue lagoon swimming pool was great fun, great atmosphere and awesome slides.
reviews.title: Okay, but take a thick wallet for the extras.

reviews.text: I wrote a glowing review of Bluestone this time last year, and this year we went back, tempted by a discount for a return visit. We still had a great weekend but it seems to have lost some sparkle and I don't think it's just because we were on a second visit. We go because it is great for the kids, they love it, they are active the whole weekend either swimming or cycling (we don't hire a buggy - anyone of reasonable fitness can get around on foot or by bike), or outdoors doing something. And we would definitely go again but considering that Bluestone isn't cheap (it's not ££££££ either by the way) I think they have let the quality slip.
reviews.title: Still had a great weekend.. but Bluestone, you need to heed your reviewers

reviews.text: Firstly: housekeeping. Now this time last year our Caldey Lodge was a bit frayed round the edges but perfectly acceptable. This year our Ramsey Lodge was .. ahem.. just plain dirty. Bluestone you need to sort this out. There are a lot of reviews on here about housekeeping. Our plugs had hair in them (eugh), the floor was NOT hoovered, the carpets dirty (why carpets anyway - surely wood floor would be more sensible), the towels had marks on them, the dishwasher didn't work (replaced), the oven was greasy... I could go on. I have written to Bluestone but not had a response yet. By the way, by comparison, the Caldey is way better than Ramsey in that price bracket. Smaller but I didn't like the upside down-ness.
reviews.title: Do not recommend at all!!

reviews.text: Food: oh my what can I say. The Saturday night hoe-down buffet that we so enjoyed the year before was dreadful. I am a veggie (not your fault I know) but really - only 1 veggie chilli option. Boring! The meat was tasteless apart from the hot chicken. And where have the buffet puddings gone. I always make up in the desert what I miss out on the main course? The whole buffet area was dirty, dishes were not refilled properly and it seemed like a whole step down on quality. Such a shame because this is such a good night for the kids.
reviews.title: Fabulous place children love it

reviews.text: What happened to Camp Smokey - last year burgers and marshmallows on the fire down there was the highlight for my 5 year old. We walked the nature trail and as we had checked it was open for food at reception we cycled there for lunch on Saturday. One surley teenager to tell us "no food", didn't even invite us in for a beer, so we turned tail and left to make beans on toast at our lodge. Bluestone.. if your reception staff don't know what's going on, how are we supposed to know.
reviews.title: First time at Bluestone

reviews.text: Bar: OK so a busy Saturday afternoon but no sign of anyone clearing the broken glass from our table (not ours I hasten to add) for over an hour. We did it ourselves in the end. This is basic stuff.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.text: There's much divided opinion on TA about Bluestone, and many comparisons with Centre Parcs. I shall try to avoid the comparison as they are so very different, and this is to the benefit of Bluestone and its visitors! I seriously hope they continue to stand apart and do something a little different as they grow and add more activities It's not Centre Parcs reader!
reviews.title: Great mix of kid and adult friendly.. will be back soon we hope

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in a Caldey lodge overlooking the lake. Our lodge was a little tired and frayed around the edges and could probably do with a lick of paint, but having said that it was comfortable and welcoming and just about had everything you need for this sort of stay.
reviews.title: Good family orientated base to explore Pembroke

reviews.text: If you're coming with young kids worthy to note that there's no plastic plates or bowls or kids cutlery so if they need it, bring it with you. I would also say that the kitchen utensil supplies are basic (as expected) so if you're planning on cooking and need some specific implement - bring it with you. Plenty of space in these lodges for 2 adults and 2 kids.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: No bath in these lodges. I'm not a fan of wetrooms, the water just gets everywhere and you could tell this had happened many times as the floor outside the bathroom had started to lift.
reviews.title: Great chalets!

reviews.text: One thing they could do to improve would be to either add a bath and over-bath shower, or just make the shower enclosed to prevent everything getting soaked. But it really isn't a big problem.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 4 night midweek break at Bluestone (myself, husband and 3 year old daughter). Overall we were happy with our stay but this is purely on the basis that we had cheap offpeak deal. If we had paid any more I would have been very unhappy.
reviews.title: Ok but could do better...

reviews.text: Booking was very easy. Our lodge was ready at 4.30 as stated on the booking information.
reviews.title: Wow what an amazing experience !!!!!

reviews.text: We had a 2 bed Romsey lodge. It was a great size for the 3 of us. However, we were very disappointed with the standard of maintenance. The walls going up the stairs were covered in dirty marks and dents. At the top of the stairs someone had had several poor attempts at drilling holes for a stair gate. Many of them had not been filled in and those that had were done poorly and not even painted over. The kitchen had good facilities but the melamine was peeling off the doors. All lodges are supposed to be non smoking but ours definitely smelled of stale smoke (not nice in your bedroom). They cannot enforce this rule so why not have separate smoking lodges so us non smokers don't have to endure the smell for our stay? The mattresses are also like sleeping on MDF board and very uncomfortable. We like firm beds but this was painful. Not what you would expect from what we had been led to believe was a top class reort. Whilst you can expect some wear and tear, the prices they are charging at peak times cannot be justified at this standard. Thankfully we had a reasonable deal being midweek and out of school holidays. We were planning on returning next year during half term but have now been put off.
reviews.title: A week at Bluestone National Park Resort

reviews.text: The big positives are the adventure centre and the lagoon pool. We were very lucky that the adventure centre was free during our stay because the Elf Kingdom took out some of the facilities. The lagoon pool is lovely but the slides are only suitable for children over 1.1m. There is a small slide in the baby pool. The changing rooms are spotlessly clean but again maintenance is an issue here with the showers only staying on for 5 seconds before going off and 2 I tried wouldn't stay on at all. There were about 15 hairdryers but only 1 was working. The adventure centre is excellent for all ages and in part makes up for the lodge standard.
reviews.title: Brilliant break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Elf school is brilliant, and our 3 year old loved it. We were lucky because we had booked early so we had this free. We could not believe the prices they are charging if you had to pay (from £23.50 and the parents also have to pay too!). Works out rediculously expensive if you are a family with 2 children. The parents just watch so why make them pay? I think far more would participate if you at least only had to pay for the children.
reviews.title: A relaxing break in nice surroundings.

description: Bluestone National Park ResortFree range holidays – Let’s play Bluestone National Park Resort is an all weather luxury short break destination like no other. Relax, unwind or play and have fun in over 500 acres of spectacular Pembrokeshire countryside - it’s all about free range holidays at Bluestone where you decide how to spend it.From generational family breaks, romantic short breaks, or celebrating an occasion with friends, guests can choose from a range of luxury lodges set around a private Welsh village with cottages and studio apartments, fine dining restaurants, shops, a pub and its very own holistic spa and thermal rooms.Choose from heart pumping activities in the Steep Ravine with its high ropes and zip wire around the old Camp Smokey; splashing fun in the Blue Lagoon waterpark and outdoor fun indoors at the Adventure Centre with its climbing walls, ball pits, Discovery Zone and Wild Wood Café.For those wanting to chill and unwind there’s The Well Spa with its holistic treatments and invigorating thermal rooms, restaurants, village pub, tranquil countryside walks and cycle routes and breath-taking scenery. Combine this with opportunities to visit the nearby coastal towns and countryside communities and you have a perfect short break destination, whatever the weather.
